page.title: 02Farming In The Area
page.content: Most of the farms in the area are mixed farms. They keep dairy cattle, beef cattle and sheep. One farm has 350 breeding sows and piglets and a fattening unit, whilst about a mile away there is a chicken farm. Some farms are arable farms with no cattle. Crops grown include cereal crops for cattle food, grass for grazing, silage and potatoes. A number of farmers specialoze in contract work. This can be ploughing, bailing combining, mowing, silaging, spraying, hedge cutting and potato harvesting. A few farmers have sold their land, leaving a large house retaining the name farm, but having only a few hectares of rough grazing land for horses and ponies.
